reference.title: DTD public identifiers
reference.shortdesc: Each document-type shell (.dtd file) or module component (.mod or .ent file) has a public identifier. The public identifier can reference either the latest version or a specific version of the document-type shell or module component.

section.title: Format
section.draft-comment: Thoughts on the following section: should change "The public identifiers use the following format:" to something like "The public identifiers for DTD files maintained by OASIS use the following format:" (we don't want to mandate or imply that everybody has to use this format, it's perfectly valid for me to declare "-//example.com//MyMeaningfulNameThatYouDoNotCareAbout//EN"
section.p:
The public identifiers use the following format:"-//OASIS//DTD DITA version information-type//EN" where:
version either is the DITA version number (for example, 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, or 1.3) or is omitted entirely.
information-type is the name of the topic or map type in camel case, for example, Concept or BookMap.
Note that "OASIS" is the owner identifier; this indicates that the artifacts are owned by OASIS. The keyword "DITA" is a convention that indicates that the artifact is DITA-related.

We already state this rule in the parent topic. Not sure which one should have it but one should be removed.Public identifiers for document-type shells that are not defined by the OASIS DITA Technical Committee SHOULD use an owner identifier that unambiguously indicates the owner of the shell, for example, "ACME" or "EXAMPLE.COM".

The entity resolution catalog? Does this mean the "catalog-dita.txt" file we used to distribute? We no longer have one single catalog that lists them all, instead we have an entry point that references a variety of other catalogs.The entity resolution catalog that is part of the DITA DTD package lists the full set of document-type shells, module components, and their associated public identifiers.

dd.lines: PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Base Topic//EN" "basetopic.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 Base Topic//EN" "basetopic.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x Base Topic//EN" "basetopic.dtd"
PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 Concept//EN" "concept.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"

dd.draft-comment: In Archspec we refer to "DITAbase", "DITABase", and "ditabase". Content models use "Ditabase". Langref has a few uses of "ditabase". Non-normative uses "ditabase" (including "Composite (ditabase)".
dd.lines: PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Composite//EN" "ditabase.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 Composite//EN" "ditabase.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x Composite//EN" "ditabase.dtd"
PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Glossary//EN" "glossary.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 Glossary//EN" "glossary.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x Glossary//EN" "glossary.dtd"

dd.note: The glossary.dtd file is provided only for backward compatibility with DITA 1.1. Use the glossentry.dtd file in new documents.

dd.lines: PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Glossary Entry//EN" "glossentry.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 Glossary Entry//EN" "glossentry.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x Glossary Entry//EN" "glossentry.dtd"

section.title: DITAVAL for conditional processing
section.lines: PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA DITAVAL//EN" "ditaval.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.x DITAVAL//EN" "ditaval.dtd" PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA 1.3 DITAVAL//EN" "ditaval.dtd"
